section.title: Introduction
section.para: PHP 5.3 is not released at the time this was written, so you won't find it in the mostly used operating systems. Here we will describe they way to install the most recent release candidate on three operating systems: Debian Linux (lenny), MacOS and Windows (XP and Vista).

section.title: Debian Linux (lenny)
section.para: At the moment we are using the PHP 5.3 RC2 packages provided by dotdeb.org until PHP 5.3 gets into the normal stable release of Debian. You should not do this in your production environment, since you will overwrite your stable and tested PHP 5.2 packages!

It may happen that your Debian installation already has PHP 5 packages installed. You need to "upgrade" to get them updated with the ones by dotdeb.org:
Now you are ready to install the required apache and php packages (don't mind if some of them are already installed, aptitude will handle that)

para.command: aptitude install apache2.. libapache.. php5 php5-sqlite...

section.para: Start apache to check if it works:
Now point your web browser to http://<ip or hostname of your server>/. If everything is ok, you should see a simple "It works!".
To get PHP 5 working, its module needs to get activated:
To check it, a simple phpinfo file needs to be created. Create an empty file named phpinfo.php under /var/www and add these lines to it:

Notice the long PHP open tag. You have to use it, because the short open tag is switched off by default in php.ini! Point your browser to http://<ip or hostname of your server>/phpinfo.php and you should see a typical phpinfo output. Check if it shows the correct version PHP 5.3 RC2. After that you should delete the file.
At this point you have a working LAMP environment with PHP 5.3, so FLOW3 can be installed.

note.para: For a comfortable and secure environment the DocRoot of apache's default webserver instance (or the vhost you are using) should be changed to the "Public" folder of FLOW3. If you use the default webserver edit /etc/apache2/sites-available/default and change every use of /var/www to /var/www/FLOW3/Public. Finally reload the webserver:

section.title: Install xampp
section.para: These instructions are based on xampp 1.7.1. They will probably work with earlier versions as well. If you have installed xampp already, just go on with the next section. If you have another PHP/Apache-Environment, reading the next section will probably also help you a lot to get PHP 5.3 running.
These instructions are not meant for live-systems. For those you'll be probably the best administrator yourself. TODO (need a clean PC first...)

section.title: Download and unzip PHP 5.3
section.para: Download the windows binaries. You need the file php-5.3-win32-ts-VC6-x86-latest.zip (PHP 5.3 - Windows x86 VC6 (thread safe))) from the "windows-binaries-download-page": http://windows.php.net/snapshots/#php-5.3-win32-ts-VC6-x86.
Add the folder C:\xampp\php\php5.3.0rc2. Extract the content of the zip-file into this new folder.

section.title: Apache Configuration
section.para: Later you will start another apache process that should have its own configuration and its own log files.
So, what you do first, is

Copy the folder C:\xampp\apache\conf\ to C:\xampp\apache\conf-php5.3.0rc2\.
Create a new folder C:\xampp\apche\logs-php5.3.0rc2\.
Now change the files the new folder conf-php5.3.0rc2\:

listitem.para: Change the port from 80 to 81: Listen 81
Adjust the includes of the configuration files: Search for conf/ and replace it with conf-php5.3.0rc2/.
Adjust the log file directory: Search for logs/ and replace it with logs-php5.3.0rc2/.
Add the configuration for using another PidFile (otherwise you might get some more entries in the error-log) by adding the following line. A good place is below ServerRoot:
Activate the module mod_rewrite by uncommenting the line:LoadModule rewrite_module modules/mod_rewrite.so

section.title: extra\httpd-ssl.comf
section.para: Change the SSL-Port: Listen 4343

section.title: extra\httpd-xampp.conf
section.para: Here you tell the apache which .dll-files it should use as PHP-module.

listitem.para:
Add the following lines:#php5.3.0rc2 settings: #Preload the PHP interpreter dll so that apache can find it, even if it's not in the path LoadFile "C:/xampp/php/php5.3.0rc2/php5ts.dll"
#Load the sapi module for Apache LoadModule php5_module "C:/xampp/php/php5.3.0rc2/php5apache2_2.dll"
#Specify the directory that the php.ini is stored in PHPIniDir "C:/xampp/php/php5.3.0rc2"

section.title: extra\httpd-vhosts.conf
section.para: Configure the VirtualHosts. Make them reference to the Public-folder of your FLOW3 installation.
section.programlisting:
NameVirtualHost *:81
<VirtualHost *:81> DocumentRoot "C:/xampp/htdocs/" ServerName localhost </VirtualHost>
<VirtualHost *:81> DocumentRoot "C:/xampp/htdocs/blog/Public/" ServerName blog.flow3.local </VirtualHost>

section.title: Solve Problems
section.para: If you have problems starting the apache, there are two places that mostly help solving them:

listitem.para: Check the error-log of the apache. (Did you choose the right log-file (you should see the start of the apache in their)?)
Have a look at the events in the Windows control panel. Usually you find more detailled information here than in the error-log if the apache crashed.
